name: Syndication Gateway
description: A connector service router that directs publications leaving Dandelion to the appropriate connector services and routes feedback back from connectors. It handles payload routing through configurable policies (Direct, HTTP, FTP, S3, External Storage), manages publication status updates, and processes product/attribute feedback. The service uses RabbitMQ for message passing and supports policy-based routing based on connector type and target schema.

name: Dandelion
description: The Salsify system that originates publications destined for connector services. Dandelion sends publish payloads through the Syndication Gateway and receives feedback and publication status updates back via the SyndicationGateway.Salsify.v1 routing key.

name: Boomerang
description: A policy type in the Syndication Gateway used for specific retailer integrations (e.g., Walmart). Boomerang policies are configured via YAML files and loaded using rake tasks to define how publications should be routed for particular connectors.
